comment.author: 26881258@N07
comment._content: This single seat fighter was designed by Elisée Alfred Descamps at the end of WW1. Puzzling all experts is that the fin of this machine has the inscription Avion Descamps Type No.27 , whereas a later (1924) two-seater also designed by Descamps was designated Descamps 16 A2. In the standard works on French aviation of WW1 this machine is mostly designated as the Descamps C 1 (Chasseur 1 - Single seat fighter]
